meanings.definition: Short, stiff hairs on the face of a man who has not shaved for a while.
meanings.sent1: He felt the rough stubbles on his chin.
meanings.sent2: The barber trimmed the stubbles carefully.
meanings.sent3: The stubbles on his face made him look rugged.
meanings.sent4: His stubbles were like tiny bristles on his jaw.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight caught the stubbles, making them shine.

meanings.definition: Short, stiff stalks of grain or other plants left in the ground after harvesting.
meanings.sent1: The farmer plowed the field, clearing the stubbles.
meanings.sent2: The stubbles in the field rustled in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the stubbles, pecking at seeds.
meanings.sent4: The stubbles stood like soldiers in the harvested field.
meanings.sent5: The golden stubbles stretched across the vast farmland.
